channel.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
channel.description: I enjoy the music played on the harpsichord, piano and the cello very much. But out of those three, which is the easiest to learn to play by yourself?

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Guitar > Piano!!

Read full topic
item.source: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:19, topic:260350”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=343738.msg2658604#msg2658604 date=1234041324]
Self taught myself Piano and sheet reading. It’s pretty easy if you keep going at it.
Now I can play Chopin’s Fantasy Impromptu; I started piano 2 years ago.
[/quote]

That’s quite impressive.

And yes, bowed string instruments are really hard to master, even with a teacher.[/quote]
If you watch some YouTube tutorials and practice the songs they become quite easy. Using the left and right hand takes practice, though. First song I learned was “1000 Miles” by Vanessa Carlton. Shitty song, but the piano sounds great.

Also, download a chart of the chords/notes. Easy way to remember is that with the black keys they go in patterns of 2, 3, 2, 3, and so on. The note before any of the 2 black keys is C, and the note before any of the 3 black keys is F.

I’d say go with Piano.

Read full topic
item.source: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:18, topic:260350”]Self taught myself Piano and sheet reading. It’s pretty easy if you keep going at it.
Now I can play Chopin’s Fantasy Impromptu; I started piano 2 years ago.[/quote]

That’s quite impressive.

And yes, bowed string instruments are really hard to master, even with a teacher.

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Self taught myself Piano and sheet reading. It’s pretty easy if you keep going at it.
Now I can play Chopin’s Fantasy Impromptu; I started piano 2 years ago.

I’ve always want to play the Cello/Violin. But I imagine they’d be hard to learn without help from someone. ie; teacher.

I’d go with Piano.
So many things online to help you with.

Read full topic
item.source: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:16, topic:260350”]I know, I just think that Cello/Piano/Harpsichord are really boring to play when you compare them to other concert instruments.
But, whatever floats your boat.[/quote]

The piano and harpsichord are mainly solo instruments, although the harpsichord was used with a cello or a fagot in the baroque. Of course all instruments can be used as a solo instrument, but some are better at it then others. And the sound matters too. I hate techno music, but the instrument (if you can call a turntable an instrument) requires you to be quite active.

Read full topic
item.source: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?

But, whatever floats your boat.

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

From what I know now, the harpsichord is easier then the piano. On a harpsichord it doesn’t matter if you gently play it or bash on the keys, the volume will be the same (is difference in volume dynamic control?)

Read full topic
item.source: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:2, topic:260350”]I’d imagine from easiest to hardest
Piano easiest
Harpsichord second easier
cello hardest[/quote]

Piano is much more difficult than the harpsichord because the harpsichord doesn’t have dynamic control. The cello is definitely a difficult instrument to learn, especially the finger positions. On a professional level however, piano would be the most difficult of the three to learn.

Read full topic

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“skiller noob1, post:7, topic:260350”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=343738.msg2654622#msg2654622 date=1233776137]
I will gladly teach you piano if you can make videos of your playing and get them to me.
[/quote]
Does he have to be naked?[/quote]

I’m so hot, he wont listen to the playing. So I’ll wear a Burqa.

Javacisnotrecognized: This is one of these things I’d love to do. But at the same time I have to be realistic. I’ve been taking guitar lessons for 2 years now, but the last year I’ve hardly played it. So I’ll have to let go of the idea for a while, and see if I still want to play a few months from now. But thanks for the offer though.

But the question still stands: which one is the easiest? I’ve already made my choice, but I still wonder.

Read full topic

item.title: How hard is it to self learn piano/harpsichord/cello?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

As I have to pay the instrument myself, I want a cheap one to start with. So I searched for some cheap harpsichords, and was shocked. The sound of those things are awesome, but the cheap ones look fugly as hell. Some are grey-greenish. For €200 you have a good looking piano and for a bit more a grand piano (needs more space, but boy those things look hot). And cello’s always look great (looks aren’t everything, but if I quit they make good furniture). But I have a hard time playing the guitar, and cello’s don’t even have frets! So unless you think the absence of frets on cello’s doesn’t matter, I think I’ll go for a piano.

Read full topic
